title: Healey proposes eliminating statute of limitations for rape when DNA evidence exists
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Governor Maura Healey proposed removing the 15-year statute of limitations for rape cases when DNA evidence is present in Massachusetts.
Healey's proposal, included in her 2027 fiscal year budget, mandates holding sexual assault evidence kits for at least 15 years.
The proposal demands law enforcement submit DNA profiles to the state database within 30 days for timely identification and prosecution.

title: Watch: Patriots share hype video ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Trevor Hass
bullets: The Patriots released a hype video before facing the Seahawks in Super Bowl LX on Sunday at 6:30 p.m.
Head coach Mike Vrabel emphasizes building a proud team identity in a meeting addressed in the video.
Wide receiver Stefon Diggs rallies teammates, stressing belief in their unique capabilities before the big game.

title: Former employee at Mass. post office pleads guilty after secretly recording female co-workers
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nicholas Testagrossa, 43, of Rindge, N.H., pleaded guilty to video voyeurism and obstruction charges at a Westminster post office.
Testagrossa recorded female co-workers by hiding a camera in the women's restroom at the post office in February and March 2025.
He faces a potential 20-year prison sentence and fines up to $350,000, with sentencing set for May 12, 2026.

title: Jewish groups sue Medford over values-based investment ordinance
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Jewish groups filed a federal lawsuit against Medford, contesting a values-based investment ordinance mandating political divestment.
The ordinance limits city investments in areas like fossil fuels, defense, and alleged human rights violations, covering all city funds.
The lawsuit claims the ordinance conflicts with state law and prioritizes ideology over financial returns, risking taxpayer interests.

title: Eight things Patriots must do to win Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots need MVP-level performance from QB Drake Maye against Seattle's strong defense in Super Bowl LX.
Patriots' defense aims to apply pressure on Seattle QB Sam Darnold to force turnovers.
Cornerback Christian Gonzalez tasked with containing Seattle's star receiver Jaxon Smith-Njigba in key matchups.

title: Willie McGinest shares how his No. 55 became an iconic piece of USC, Patriots history
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Willie McGinest wore No. 55 at both USC and the New England Patriots, a tradition started by Junior Seau.
Junior Seau's success at USC led to No. 55 being a special jersey for top linebackers, worn by McGinest and Seau.
Brandon Spikes continued the No. 55 tradition in New England, with Bill Belichick encouraging its legacy within the team.

title: Snow totals: See how much your town received
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Essex County experienced the highest snowfall, with Salisbury and Beverly receiving 13 inches each during February 7's winter storm.
Bristol County reported significant snow, with Dartmouth receiving 8.2 inches, the highest in the county.
Snow totals varied across other counties, with Middlesex seeing up to 7 inches and Norfolk reporting up to 5.5 inches.

title: For all he’s done, Mike Tirico will experience ‘thrill of a lifetime’ calling first Super Bowl for NBC
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Mike Tirico will call his first Super Bowl for NBC as the Patriots face the Seahawks in Santa Clara.
Tirico will handle both Super Bowl and Olympic broadcasting duties, marking a significant milestone in his career.
NBC's Super Bowl coverage includes Cris Collinsworth, Maria Taylor, Devin McCourty, and Rodney Harrison, among others.

title: 60 fun facts, stats, and things to know about Super Bowl LX before Patriots take on Seahawks
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots are underdogs against the Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl LX at Levi's Stadium, Santa Clara.
Patriots quarterback Drake Maye could become the youngest ever Super Bowl-winning QB at 23 if they win on Sunday.
Seahawks led the league in scoring defense this season, while Patriots are second in regular-season scoring.

title: Patriots’ Mike Vrabel reportedly received pointers from Bill Belichick and a rival coach ahead of Super Bowl LX
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots' Mike Vrabel sought advice from Bill Belichick and Chiefs' Andy Reid before coaching his first Super Bowl.
Vrabel also consulted Patriots offensive coordinator Josh McDaniels, who has participated in 10 Super Bowls.
Vrabel led the Patriots to a 14-win season, winning Coach of the Year after consecutive four-win seasons.
